docs.snippet: To the Editor:    ''Israel Persisting With Wide Sweep Despite U.S. Calls'' (front page, April 8) puts Prime Minister Ariel Sharon in the unforgiving position of possibly winning the war on terrorism while losing the war of perception. It has becom...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Israel Persisting With Wide Sweep Despite U.S. Calls'' (front page, April 8) puts Prime Minister Ariel Sharon in the unforgiving position of possibly winning the war on terrorism while losing the war of perception. It has become Israel versus the Palestinians, rather than Hamas or Fatah, the two movements in the forefront of terrorism.
docs.abstract: Richard L Gilbert letter comments on April 8 article on Israel's military sweep on West Bank0

headline.main: Israel and America, Out of Step

docs.snippet: The Navy has detained four protesters who tried to interrupt shelling exercises at a bombing range on the island of Vieques. The arrests brought to nine the number of protesters detained in the latest protest of war games, which began on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Navy has detained four protesters who tried to interrupt shelling exercises at a bombing range on the island of Vieques. The arrests brought to nine the number of protesters detained in the latest protest of war games, which began on Monday.

docs.snippet: A front-page article on Saturday about Secretary of State Colin L. Powell's visit to Afghanistan misstated the cost of conducting the war there. While estimates vary, the monthly cost to the United States has far exceeded $90 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: A front-page article on Saturday about Secretary of State Colin L. Powell's visit to Afghanistan misstated the cost of conducting the war there. While estimates vary, the monthly cost to the United States has far exceeded $90 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: As announced yesterday, coverage of the war in Afghanistan and the aftermath of the Sept. 11 terror raids, formerly presented as a separate section, now appears in the main parts of The Times. Today, Pages A10-14. SportsTuesday resumes as a separate Section D.
